# National Anthem of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia__disambig_1

1918
|composer      = Davorin Jenko and Josif Runjanin
|music_date= 1918
|adopted =
|until =
|predecessor ="Bo≈æe pravde" (as Kingdom of Serbia)"Ubavoj nam Crnoj Gori (as Kingdom of Montenegro)"Gott erhalte Franz den Kaiser" (as part of Austria-Hungary)"Shumi Maritsa" and "Anthem of His Majesty the Tsar" (as part of Kingdom of Bulgaria)
|successor= "Hey, Slavs" (as Socialist Yugoslavia)"Deutschlandlied" and "Horst-Wessel-Lied" (as part of Nazi Germany)"Lijepa na≈°a domovino" (as part of Independent State of Croatia)"Marcia Reale" and "Giovinezza" (as part of Fascist Kingdom of Italy)"Himnusz" (as part of Kingdom of Hungary)"Shumi Maritsa" and "Anthem of His Majesty the Tsar" (as part of Kingdom of Bulgaria)

The Anthem of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia}} was created in December 1918 from the national anthems of the Kingdom's three historical constituent lands: Kingdom of Croatia-Slavonia (Croatia), Kingdom of Serbia (Serbia) and Duchy of Carniola (Slovenia).
At the time, the Yugoslav authorities considered the three dominant South Slavic ethnic groups ‚Äì Croats, Serbs, and Slovenes ‚Äì as three interchangeable names for one ethnic group (Serbo-Croatian and  "nation" or "people"), while the Pan-Slavic politicians and parts of academia viewed them as three subgroups of one South Slavic nation (,  ; "Yugoslavs"). Accordingly, the official language was thus called Serbo-Croato-Slovene.
History
Although a law on the national anthem did not exist, the anthems of all three South Slavic nations were unified into a single anthem of the Kingdom. It started with the first part of the Serbian anthem "Bo≈æe pravde", continued with the first verse of the Croatian anthem "Lijepa na≈°a domovino", which were in turn followed by first verse the  de facto  Slovenian anthem "Naprej zastava slave". The anthem finished with the refrain of the first verse of the Serbian anthem again.
It was officially used between 1919 and 1941; there was no official document that declared it invalid or void. The Constitution of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia was not in effect after the April capitulation.

|God of Justice; Thou who saved us
when in deepest bondage cast,
Hear Thy Serbian children's voices,
Be our help as in the past.
Our beautiful homeland,
Oh heroic, dear land,
Fatherland of old glory,
May you be forever blissful.
ùÑÜ Onward, banner of glory,
to battle, heroic blood!
for the sake of the fatherland
let the rifles sound! ùÑá
God save, God sustain,
Our king and our people!
God sustain King Peter,
All our people pray to you.
|}
